section: The business name of the Venture will be BM&V2GO, however the partnership name will be Vaccines2Go.
explanation: The document states two different names for the same entity, the joint venture. This creates confusion and ambiguity about which name should be used for official purposes. This constitutes an in-text contradiction as it uses two names without clarification of the context for each.

section: *HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements including a database for medical dispatch personal & product service as needed, including activity information, data storage and backup. provided by three qualified assigned Borrowmoney.com, inc. employees/personal
explanation: This text lacks proper structure and clarity. The use of '*HTML code...' makes the text difficult to comprehend. Furthermore, it does not state the obligations of the Members properly. The text also contains grammatical errors and missing information. It uses HTML code in a Legal document which makes the structure bad.
location: Member Duties section, under BorrowMoney.com, inc

section: 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty*
explanation: This text contains a structural flaw. The phrase "Includingspecified Description of duty*" is grammatically incorrect and lacks clear meaning. This makes the contribution unclear and ambiguous. The sentence structure is non-sensical and makes it hard to understand the contribution.

section: JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions.
explanation: The phrasing regarding JVLS, LLC's contribution lacks clarity. It's unclear whether the $60,000 is a one-time contribution, an ongoing monthly contribution, or something else entirely. The phrase "Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions." is vague because it doesn't specify the timeframe for this additional revenue share. Is it monthly, annually, or over the term of the agreement? The inconsistency in spacing adds to the confusion. This lack of clarity leads to multiple interpretations, which is a characteristic of ambiguity. The way the monetary contributions are detailed structurally does not make sense and is hard to understand.

section: Where joint ventures are not recognized by statute as separate legal entities, Venture property, including intellectual property, will be held in the name of one or more Members. In all cases Venture property will be applied by the Members exclusively for the benefit and purposes of the Venture and in accordance with this Agreement.
explanation: This section contains a contradictory statement. It first states that if joint ventures are not recognized, property will be held in the name of one or more members. However, it then states that in all cases Venture property will be applied by the Members exclusively for the benefit and purposes of the Venture. If the joint venture is not recognized, then the Member has total control of the assets, meaning they can technically do what they want with the funds. This means they can technically go against the Joint Venture since the venture is not technically recognized.

section: Any management vote required will be determined such that each Manager receives one vote carrying equal weight, unless otherwise decided by BorrowMoney.com inc.
explanation: This section states that each manager gets one equal vote, but it contradicts itself by stating BorrowMoney.com inc. can decide otherwise. This creates ambiguity. The phrase "unless otherwise decided by BorrowMoney.com inc." grants disproportionate power to one member, undermining the initial statement of equal voting rights. This clause creates an in-text contradiction regarding the management voting process.
